instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL>. What am I doing wrong here?
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0.5v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> SHORTED TO GROUND

Can't find the short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL>. What am I doing wrong here?
threads.message: First you check for a short from PPBUS to any of the coils on the board (shorted high side FET somewhere). If that is ruled out inject voltage on PPBUS and see what heats up. Start with 1V and slowly go up if you can't find it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL>. What am I doing wrong here?
threads.message:
Nothing from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to the inductors, not even L7130 because F7140 had already blew at some point, but the short is either side of the broken fuse.
Already tried removing <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and every other FET and cap and IC I can find on the schema that looks remotely like it may create a dead short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. So, I tried connecting up the power supply which went into limiting immediately. Turned it up slow, no heat, turned it up a little more, no heat..... Decided F* this board and passed 25W through it. Can you guess what got hot?.......... The fucking power supply :)
Board was cool as a cucumber

To blow an 8A 24V fuse, what are the chances of a short on an inner layer(s) you recon?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL>. What am I doing wrong here?
threads.message: If the short is on both sides of F7140 with it removed then there must be more wrong then just something shorted. Could be internal short in the board yes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL>. What am I doing wrong here?
threads.message: Thanks for you help. Bin this one.
